In this lesson, you will learn the basic concepts and methods of Spatial Interaction Models.

## Content

-   Basic Concepts of Spatial Interaction Models
    -   A Family of Gravity Models
        -   Unconstrained
        -   Origin constrained
        -   Destination constrained
        -   Doubly constrained
    -   Statistical Approach
    -   Interpreting and Visualising Modelling Results
-   Spatial Econometric Interaction Models
    -   The general formula
        -   What is Econometrics?
        -   What is Spatial Econometrics?
    -   Spatial Econometric Interaction Model Specifications

## Self-reading Before Meet-up

Read before lesson:

-   Kingsley E. Haynes and A. Stewart Fotheringham (2020) [**Gravity and Spatial Interaction Models**](https://researchrepository.wvu.edu/rri-web-book/16/), Web Book of Regional Science. Chapter 1 and Sub-section 2.2.
-   Farmer, C. and Oshan, T. (2017). ["Spatial interaction"](https://gistbok.ucgis.org/bok-topics/spatial-interaction). **The Geographic Information Science & Technology Body of Knowledge** (4th Quarter 2017 Edition), John P. Wilson (ed.). DOI: 10.22224/gistbok/2017.4.5 (link is external)
-   Flowerdew R, Aitkin M (1982) ["A method of fitting the gravity model based on the Poisson distribution"](https://www.academia.edu/38321611/A_Method_of_Fitting_the_Gravity_Model_Based_on_the_Poisson_Distribution_). *Journal of Regional Science*, 22: 191--202.
-   [" Chapter 6. Spatial econometrics - common models"](https://www.insee.fr/en/statistiques/fichier/3635545/imet131-j-chapitre-6.pdf), Handbook of Spatial Analysis.
-   James P. LeSage and R. Kelley Pace (2008) ["Spatial Econometric Modeling of Origin-Destination Flows"](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1111/j.1467-9787.2008.00573.x). *Journal of Regional Science*, Vol. 48, No. 5, pp. 941-967.
